posts.edge_media_to_caption:
[Life Inspiration] As of yesterday Iâ€™ve completely changed up my Instagram to give you guys more of what you want, and you told me that you want career and life inspiration, travel stories and photography tips! And Iâ€™ve asked that if you like what Iâ€™m doing give me the â€œ1,2,3â€: 1) Read the caption 2) Give me feedback and 3) Tag your friends. Today Iâ€™m going to share some of my daily habits that give me focus and motivation. 
_________________________________
1ï¸âƒ£ Every single day I practice mindfulness. Iâ€™ve known for years that this is something I need, but Iâ€™ve been bad at executing. So now I either meditate, do yoga, do a gratitude exercise or all 3! If you can master your mind then literally every single other aspect of your life will start to fall into place. ğŸ§˜ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸ğŸ’œ
_________________________________
2ï¸âƒ£ Planning! Iâ€™ve always worked hard, and a lot, but never with any clear direction in mind. Now Iâ€™m becoming a master at visualizing my biggest dreams and reverse engineering what it takes to get there. Iâ€™m also working with a business coach and she is AMAZING! The techniques that Iâ€™m learning to achieve my goals is blowing my mind! Thank you @AdventuressKait âœˆï¸ğŸŒˆ
_________________________________
3ï¸âƒ£ Food that nourishes my body and mind! When youâ€™re eating well and giving your body the food it actually needs, rather than what it craves, youâ€™ll find a new level of focus that you didnâ€™t think was possible. Check out my story highlights for my new lifestyle around food. ğŸ¥‘ğŸ“ğŸ¥¥ğŸ§€ğŸ·ğŸ«
_________________________________
4ï¸âƒ£ Thereâ€™s plenty more you can do to stay motivated and some of my faves include: exercise, journaling (a new habit), not sleeping with my phone in the bedroom, and not using it for an hour after I wake up, and choosing to spend my time with people that lift me up! ğŸˆ â€œYour Network equals your Net Worthâ€ - @KerwinRae ğŸ“’ğŸ™…ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸ğŸ“±ğŸš´ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸

posts.edge_media_to_caption:
Announcement: you asked, I listened! This week I did a big Instagram Story (check my highlights reel for â€œLife 2019â€) and asked you what you want to see more of on my Instagram account? You overwhelmingly asked for career and life inspiration, travel stories and photography tips. Although a huge amount of you are also interested in recipes and health stuff. ğŸ˜‚ So I am super proud to start giving you more of what you want, to really listen to you guys. And you can give me what I want too ... My purpose in life is to inspire others to live their dreams. In order to reach more people I want to create an Instagram account that provides even more incredible and valuable content for you to use to achieve your goals. So, I promise to put my heart and soul into this if you can do three things for me? 1) Read the caption! Thatâ€™s where all the good stuff will be. 2) Give me feedback. Love it or hate it? Anything to add? I donâ€™t know if you donâ€™t tell me. Leave comments on my posts. 3) If something resonates with you then tag your friends! Iâ€™m also going to start rolling out more Stories, more LIVEâ€™s and Iâ€™m starting my IGTV channel soon! Iâ€™m excited for this new chapter in my life, and in the life of my old Instagram account. â¤ï¸ PS. Someone asked for a minimalist shot on my story, youâ€™re welcome. ğŸ˜˜
.

posts.edge_media_to_caption:
I canâ€™t believe it! I finally managed to post out my top 12 favourite shots from 2018! It might be almost April but I donâ€™t care! Iâ€™m so proud that I had the time to do this, itâ€™s so important to celebrate your achievements and this collection of images is an achievement for me. Thanks so much to Olympus for providing me the amazing gear to capture all of these shots. For more info on this shot keep reading ...
_________________________________
Gear and Settings:
â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸
ğŸ”¹ @olympus_au  E-M1 Mark II

ğŸ”¹ Gitzo Tripod
ğŸ”¹ ISO LOW (64)
ğŸ”¹ F 16
ğŸ”¹ 1/3 second

ğŸ“ I donâ€™t know why this shot made it into my top 12, certainly I have photos that got more â€˜likesâ€™ or that are more eye-catching. Perhaps itâ€™s because I had to work for this one! The exposure was HARD! Lots and lots of dark foreground, a stream of white water and a glaring sun blowing my highlights out everywhere! In the end I came up with a composition that worked and managed a gorgeous, even exposure despite the challenges. It doesnâ€™t hurt that I was at Mount Buffalo, one of my favorite places in Australia. And yes, I know that I say that about all the places. ğŸ˜‚

posts.edge_media_to_caption:
I went to Etosha National Park in Namibia and saw rhino, lion and baby jackals but for some reason I shared mainly giraffe photos! ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ (The good news is that I have latergrams for days!) This shoot was interesting for me because I had time to play around, and someone feeding me ideas! (My Safari driver) 
_________________________________
Gear and Settings:
â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸
ğŸ”¹ @olympus_au  E-M1 Mark II
ğŸ”¹ M. Zuiko 300 mm f4 ğŸ”¹ Hand held
ğŸ”¹ ISO 200
ğŸ”¹ F 4
ğŸ”¹ 1/1000
__________________________________
ğŸ“ So my driver had mentioned that he had taken a cool photo of a giraffe coming up from a drink once and I immediately envisioned this photo. It was pretty tricky to execute though, because giraffes are skittish drinkers and when they rise up itâ€™s usually unpredictable and fast! In order to get the shot I actually set a manual focus right on the giraffes eye, after I watched for a while how he rose up. (Vertically) Every time I sensed him about to move I rapid fired in continuous burst mode and did this a handful of times to get the best shot. Voila! 
__________________________________
#olympusinspired ğŸ“¸ Learn photography from me, link in bio. ğŸ’ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸

posts.edge_media_to_caption:
Literally the best sunrise Iâ€™ve seen in forever, AND I WAS ON TOP OF A MOUNTAIN! Incidentally this was also one of the scariest things Iâ€™ve done in my life, hiking the Wilpena Pound by myself IN THE DARK! Every bird, every branch snap, every kangaroo, every rustle ... WAS A MURDERER IN MY MIND! ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ And yet this is one of my proudest accomplishments of last year. Hereâ€™s how the photography side went down...
_________________________________
Gear and Settings:
â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸
ğŸ”¹ @olympus_au  E-M1 Mark II
ğŸ”¹ M. Zuiko 7-14 mm PRO Lens
ğŸ”¹ Gitzo Tripod and self timer ğŸ”¹ ISO 200
ğŸ”¹ F 11
ğŸ”¹ 1/2 second 
__________________________________
ğŸ“ So I had hiked a mountain in the dark and I got to the top just as it started to look like sunrise had potential. Imagine how surprised I was to have gone to such effort for sunrise only to see it pay off! That never happens to me. ğŸ˜³ğŸ˜‚ I was so overwhelmed that I didnâ€™t think much, I just wanted to get a great hero shot. I sussed out a few angles that I liked and then focused solely on getting one killer image, rather than heaps of average ones. Definitely a favourite for 2018! 
__________________________________
#olympusinspired ğŸ“¸ Learn photography from me, link in bio. ğŸ’ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸

Why did the elephants cross the train tracks? ğŸšŠğŸ˜ Itâ€™s not a joke, I actually donâ€™t know the answer. ğŸ˜‚ I was out and about on a safari drive in Hwange National Park when our guide saw a huge herd of elephants heading for the train tracks. He predicted that they might cross and got us into position. And then ...
_________________________________
Gear and Settings:
â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸

ğŸ”¹ 1/800

ğŸ“ I literally jumped from the safari vehicle as it was still coming to a stop so that I could get to the tracks quickly enough for the crossing. I was relatively far away to not scare them and I knew I wanted a nice low angle with the leading line of the train track. I snapped on my longest zoom lens, positioned myself in the middle of the track and laid down on my stomach. (Donâ€™t worry, there was no risk of trains) When a situation like this strikes itâ€™s important to be thinking on the fly. Figuring out your game plan as youâ€™re executing it. â¤ï¸ğŸ˜

posts.edge_media_to_caption:
This is post number 7 in my 12 part series of top posts for last year. As I say, better late than never. Haha. As many of you know, last year I went to Zimbabwe in February to do a complete run through of my planned itinerary for running tours. I needed to make sure that my trip would be life changing, beautiful, humbling, overwhelming and organized! Haha. During this trip I was mainly focused on making a promotional video, but I also got some of my favorite shots of the year. This is a pangolin from one of the sanctuaries we will visit when my first tour kicks off in April. â¤ï¸
_________________________________
Gear and Settings:
â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸
ğŸ”¹ @olympus_au  E-M1 Mark II
ğŸ”¹ M. Zuiko 40-150 mm PRO lens
ğŸ”¹ Hand held
ğŸ”¹ ISO 800
ğŸ”¹ F 2.8
ğŸ”¹ 1/200
__________________________________
ğŸ“ Marimba is a very special girl, a representative of her species and a shining beacon of hope for pangolinâ€™s around the world. Sheâ€™s a rescue, a lucky girl considering pangolinâ€™s are one of the most heavily trafficked mammals on the planet. I wanted to capture her being cradled by her beloved handler, to showcase her trust and vulnerability. I also didnâ€™t want to scare her by being too close, hence the telephoto lens. I tried different settings, and the light was low, but eventually went for f2.8 and focused on her expressive eyes. 
__________________________________
#olympusinspired ğŸ“¸ Learn photography from me, link in bio. ğŸ’ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸

This picture was a complete surprise to me! I was in Tasmania on an actual holiday with Dreamboat! As in, I didnâ€™t even have to take photos but of course I wanted to because ... photos rock! I was on the West Coast doing the new Gordon River Cruise. It was fairly overcast but we rounded a corner and were faced with ... ğŸ™ŒğŸ»
_________________________________
Gear and Settings:
â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸
ğŸ”¹ @olympus_au  E-M1 Mark II
ğŸ”¹ M. Zuiko 40-150 mm PRO lens
ğŸ”¹ Hand held
ğŸ”¹ ISO LOW (64)
ğŸ”¹ F 2.8
ğŸ”¹ 1/320
__________________________________
ğŸ“ Since I wasnâ€™t on an official job I had my camera, but wasnâ€™t that serious about using it. The light was pretty low so my aperture was wide open, not ideal for landscapes. But ... the sky opened and the light was shining and it all happened in the blink of an eye so it was a quick snap and then it was gone again. Even though my settings were technically wrong, itâ€™s the shot that matters. And I love this shot. â¤ï¸ This is proof that sometimes being in the right place at the right time is more important than nailing all the technical stuff. 
__________________________________

posts.edge_media_to_caption:
This is a really fitting image to post tonight as thunder and lighting storms tear across the Gold Coast. âš¡ï¸âš¡ï¸ Youâ€™ll see that a number of my top 12 images from 2018 were shot in Zimbabwe, this is the first one Iâ€™m sharing. Iâ€™m SUPER excited to be heading over to Zim in just over a month to run my first ever tours! ğŸ˜ğŸ˜
_________________________________
Gear and Settings:
â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸
ğŸ”¹ @olympus_au  E-M1 Mark II
ğŸ”¹ M. Zuiko 12-40 mm PRO lens
ğŸ”¹ Gitzo Tripod
ğŸ”¹ Live Composite Mode ğŸ”¹ ISO 400
ğŸ”¹ F 4
ğŸ”¹ 20 seconds (multiple times)
__________________________________
ğŸ“ I took this image in Victoria Falls on the deck of my lodge. We had come back from a day of sightseeing and I was personally very happy to be packing my camera away for the day, when this started! I reluctantly set up my camera on the tripod and activated Live Composite mode, AKA miracle mode, and let the Olympus do its work. When I checked it after about 10/15 minutes this was what I saw! Meanwhile, I was sitting down enjoying a glass of wine and dinner while my camera did all the work. 
__________________________________

Iâ€™m sure that most of you probably wonâ€™t even remember this shot, taken last year in Slovenia on an actual holiday! It made it to my 2018 TOP 12 because it was such a fun and unexpected adventure. Dreamboat and I got talking to a couple of locals and they took it took themselves to show us around! This was one of their secret spots, just over the border into Italy and GORGEOUS! And, in fact, I still follow Peter. Iâ€™ll tag him in!
_________________________________
Gear and Settings:
â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸

ğŸ”¹ F 16
ğŸ”¹ 3.2 seconds

ğŸ“ This was one of the rare instances where I really needed a wide angle lens to fit everything into the shot, and I opted for my little utilized Olympus 7-14mm PRO lens. Although the water was super calm I wanted to smooth it right out so I used both a graduated neutral density filter and a neutral density filter to darken down the scene. Apart from that, not much was required. It was a pretty stunning location! 
__________________________________
